title: The Block 2019 episode 37 recap: Will Tess and Luke walk out?
text:
Jesse and Mel have always been willing to go the extra mile (or should that be the extra tile) for a win.

Foreman Keith said it couldn’t be done, but the duo proved him wrong and painstakingly laid 105,215 mosaic tiles over 24 hours. All by themselves.

RELATED:

Ep 35 and 36 recap: Reason for Tess and Luke’s devastation

Do The Block contestants get bargain tradies?

Of course, Keith still doesn’t know that real estate agent Jesse is actually a qualified tiler. It’s a fact that the notorious big noter has managed to keep close to his chest throughout the gruelling TV renovation.

The outspoken duo’s efforts wowed judges Shaynna Blaze, Neale Whitaker and Darren Palmer who described Jesse and Mel’s courtyard as “expensive-looking”.

And we all know how much Jesse loves the word “expensive”.

Their victory came as no surprise to Jesse who proudly declared he comes to every judging expecting to win.

“It looks like a magazine,” he said of his own courtyard, without the slightest hint of false modesty.

“Form and function, it is hands down the best courtyard on The Block.”

Jesse and Mel’s win takes them another step closer to winning The Block altogether. It also takes the top prize further and further away from the grasp of Mat and El’ise, Tess and Luke and Andy and Deb.

Currently, only Jesse and Mel and Mitch and Mark have enough funds to see the entire property renovation through.

And that is causing tensions within the group.

While Matt and El’ise, Tess and Luke and Andy and Deb are facing the very real possibility that they won’t have enough money to finish the full renovation, Mitch and Mark are gleefully plotting to put a potentially game-winning spa bath on their top deck.

But to get their spa across the line they need the support of at least three teams. Jesse and Mel have already made it clear that they will oppose the idea because they don’t want to give Mitch and Mark any kind of advantage in what is shaping to become a two-horse race.

The spa plan opened old wounds for El’ise who has never quite gotten over the fact she won’t able to afford to put a pool in at her place. Mitch and Mark were gobsmacked by her OTT reaction to their plans. Let’s just say, if the boys get their spa approved, they will be able to fill it with El’ise tears over the injustice of it all.

However, gripped with fear she will be yet again the bad guy, El’ise quickly set about trying to convince the nicest person on the show, Deb, to do her dirty work instead.

Poor ever-smiling Deb. She hates to ruffle feathers. If you recall, she ended up comforting El’ise when she extorted $5000 from Deb and Andy to secure her support for them having an upstairs terrace.

Back then, Mitch and Mark needed no such cash incentive to back Andy and Deb and Tess’s desire for upstairs terraces. They were also quick to put El’ise in her place for demanding the pay-off. And so, they foolishly thought what goes around comes around, and that the two couples would help them take the plunge with the spa.

Of course, that was back when everyone still believed they had a fighting chance at winning. Now, while Jesse is the only one willing to voice it openly, nobody is eager to give the boys any more of a winning edge than they already have.

So, the three cash-strapped couples have asked for some time to discuss the matter with their real estate agents.

And that has really got Mitch and Mark in a tizz.

“It’s just surprising because when we were in a very similar position, we basically said we will back you. We have your back. It now shows that their loyalty is flawed,” Mitch spit, with a look of thunder on his face.

The equally clearly peeved Mark makes their position clear, warning the others that if they don’t get their votes then it will be no more Mr Nice Guys for the final five weeks.

That ultimatum hit Tess and Luke hard.

They are already fearful that The Block may have been a complete waste of their time to the extent that a tearful and frustrated Tess has told her husband, after the courtyard judging, that it may be time to down tools and head home to Cairns.

Now that would be a Block first!
